intro: Kickxia aegyptiaca subsp. battandieri, commonly known as the Egyptian spurge or Persian spurge, is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. It is native to regions of the Mediterranean and Central Asia, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some areas.
